com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Interface GroupLayer

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, Layer
All Known Subinterfaces:
ImageServerLayer, Layerset
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseGroupLayer, BaseImageServerLayer, BaseLayerset
public interface GroupLayer
extends Layer

A GroupLayer is an ordered collection of Layers.

The order of the collection determines a draw order on a Display. The first layer in the collection will be drawn first, therefore is shown underneath all other layers, whereas, the last layer in the collection is drawn last, and thus appears on top of all other layers.

Each Layer can be identified by either itself (a Layer reference) or by the layer index which is the layer's index location within the the ordered collection.

See Also:
Display

Method Detail

addLayer

public void addLayer(Layer l)
Adds a new layer to the end of collection - thus it will be drawn on top. After adding the Layer, the Layer's parent will become this GroupLayer

Parameters:
l - the layer

clear

public void clear()
Removes all layers from the collection.

removeLayer

public void removeLayer(Layer l)
                 throws LayerNotFoundException
Removes a layer. After removing the Layer, the Layer's parent will become null

Parameters:
l - the layer
Throws:
LayerNotFoundException - if the Layer is not present in the collection

removeLayerAt

public void removeLayerAt(int i)
                   throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Removes a layer. After removing the Layer, the Layer's parent will become null

Parameters:
i - the layer index
Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out-of-bounds

moveLayer

public void moveLayer(int i,
                      int n)
               throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Moves a layer.

The layer is moved to a new index in the collection, and therefore causes a change in the draw order. No move occurs if the 2 indexes are identical.

Parameters:
i - the index of the layer to be moved
n - the index that the Layer should be moved to
Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if either index is out-of-bounds

findLayer

public int findLayer(String name)
Finds a Layer given its name. Normally, this will be a case-independent search.

Returns:
the index of the Layer found, or -1 == not found

traverse

public void traverse(LayerVisitor visitor,
                     boolean order)
With this method you can traverse the GroupLayer tree and visit it in either the forward or reverse order.

Parameters:
visitor - the object that will be visiting each Layer in this GroupLayer
order - true == forward (same as regular traverse), false == reverse order
Throws:
RuntimeException - may be thrown by the LayerVisitor in order to quickly terminate the traversal - it is calling code's responsibility to trap this exception
See Also:
LayerVisitor
